channel.title: attack.lateral_movement on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.lateral_movement on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Remote DCOM/WMI Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls that performs remote DCOM operations. These could be abused for lateral movement via DCOM or WMI.

item.title: Remote Encrypting File System Abuse
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to possibly abuse remote encryption service via MS-EFSR

item.title: Remote Printing Abuse for Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to possibly abuse remote printing service via MS-RPRN / MS-PAR

item.title: Remote Registry Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to modify the registry and possible execute code

item.title: Remote Schedule Task Lateral Movement via ATSvc
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to create or execute a scheduled task via ATSvc

item.title: Remote Schedule Task Lateral Movement via ITaskSchedulerService
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to create or execute a scheduled task

item.title: Remote Schedule Task Lateral Movement via SASec
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to create or execute a scheduled task via SASec

item.title: Remote Server Service Abuse
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to possibly abuse remote encryption service via MS-SRVS

item.title: Remote Server Service Abuse for Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects remote RPC calls to possibly abuse remote encryption service via MS-EFSR

item.title: Possible Exploitation of Exchange RCE CVE-2021-42321
item.description: Detects log entries that appear in exploitation attempts against MS Exchange RCE CVE-2021-42321

item.title: AWS Suspicious SAML Activity
item.description: Identifies when suspicious SAML activity has occurred in AWS. An adversary could gain backdoor access via SAML.

item.title: OMIGOD HTTP No Authentication RCE
item.description: Detects the exploitation of OMIGOD (CVE-2021-38647) which allows remote execute (RCE) commands as root with just a single unauthenticated HTTP request. Verify, successful, exploitation by viewing the HTTP client (request) body to see what was passed to the server (using PCAP). Within the client body is where the code execution would occur. Additionally, check the endpoint logs to see if suspicious commands or activity occurred within the timeframe of this HTTP request.

item.title: AWS STS GetSessionToken Misuse
item.description: Identifies the suspicious use of GetSessionToken. Tokens could be created and used by attackers to move laterally and escalate privileges.

item.title: AWS STS AssumeRole Misuse
item.description: Identifies the suspicious use of AssumeRole. Attackers could move laterally and escalate privileges.

item.title: Impacket PsExec Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Impacket’s psexec.py.

item.title: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
item.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands

item.title: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
item.description: This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop. Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.

item.title: Remote File Copy
item.description: Detects the use of tools that copy files from or to remote systems

item.title: MSTSC Shadowing
item.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: Copy from Admin Share
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command to or from an Admin share

item.title: External Disk Drive Or USB Storage Device
item.description: Detects external diskdrives or plugged in USB devices , EventID 6416 on windows 10 or later

item.title: Cisco Stage Data
item.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

item.title: Protected Storage Service Access
item.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers

item.title: Register new Logon Process by Rubeus
item.description: Detects potential use of Rubeus via registered new trusted logon process

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'
item.description: The ‘LsaRegisterLogonProcess’ function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell connections by monitoring network outbound connections to ports 5985 or 5986 from a non-network service account.

item.title: Remote PowerShell Session
item.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions

item.title: Potential RDP Exploit CVE-2019-0708
item.description: Detect suspicious error on protocol RDP, potential CVE-2019-0708

item.title: Terminal Service Process Spawn
item.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: RDP Login from Localhost
item.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login

item.title: Net.exe Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.

item.title: Rubeus Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Rubeus hack tool

item.title: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON
item.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe

item.title: smbexec.py Service Installation
item.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation

item.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
item.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz’s sekurlsa::pth module.

item.title: Admin User Remote Logon
item.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user (depending on internal pattern).

item.title: Microsoft Binary Github Communication
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing github.com

item.title: Microsoft Binary Suspicious Communication Endpoint
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing suspicious domains

item.title: Interactive Logon to Server Systems
item.description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems

item.title: Access to ADMIN$ Share
item.description: Detects access to $ADMIN share

item.title: Mimikatz Use
item.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations in Registry
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement. We can also catch this by system log 7045 (https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/builtin/win_cobaltstrike_service_installs.yml) In some SIEM you can catch those events also in HKLM\System\ControlSet001\Services or HKLM\System\ControlSet002\Services, however, this rule is based on a regular sysmon’s events.

item.title: DCERPC SMB Spoolss Named Pipe
item.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

item.title: Enable Windows Remote Management
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to interact with remote systems using Windows Remote Management (WinRM). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: Execute Invoke-command on Remote Host
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to interact with remote systems using Windows Remote Management (WinRM). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv
item.description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: Metasploit SMB Authentication
item.description: Alerts on Metasploit host’s authentications on the domain.

item.title: Mounted Windows Admin Shares with net.exe
item.description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding (PortProxy)

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: NTLM Logon
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers

item.title: Pandemic Registry Key
item.description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant

item.title: Pass the Hash Activity
item.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: PortProxy Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding. For command execution see rule win_netsh_port_fwd.yml.

item.title: PsExec Pipes Artifacts
item.description: Detecting use PsExec via Pipe Creation/Access to pipes

item.title: Remote Desktop Protocol Use Mstsc
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers
item.description: Detect potential adversaries leveraging WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers remotely to move laterally in a network

item.title: Rundll32 Without Parameters
item.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

item.title: Scanner PoC for CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE Vuln
item.description: Detects the use of a scanner by zerosum0x0 that discovers targets vulnerable to CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE aka BlueKeep

item.title: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share
item.description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).

item.title: SMB Spoolss Name Piped Usage
item.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

item.title: Suspicious Add User to Remote Desktop Users Group
item.description: Detects suspicious command line in which a user gets added to the local Remote Desktop Users group

item.title: Suspicious New-PSDrive to Admin Share
item.description: Adversaries may use to interact with a remote network share using Server Message Block (SMB). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: Suspicious Non PowerShell WSMAN COM Provider
item.description: Detects suspicious use of the WSMAN provider without PowerShell.exe as the host application.

item.title: Suspicious Plink Remote Forwarding
item.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel remote forarding to a local port

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious Remote Logon with Explicit Credentials
item.description: Detects suspicious processes logging on with explicit credentials

item.title: Suspicious UltraVNC Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)

item.title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named iertutil.dll in the C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\ directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named iertutil.dll in the C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\ directory over the network and loading it for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: WinRM Access with Evil-WinRM
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: WMI Script Host Process Image Loaded
item.description: Detects signs of the WMI script host process %SystemRoot%\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe functionality being used via images being loaded by a process.

item.title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: Writing Local Admin Share
item.description: Aversaries may use to interact with a remote network share using Server Message Block (SMB). This technique is used by post-exploitation frameworks.

item.title: Zerologon Exploitation Using Well-known Tools
item.description: This rule is designed to detect attempts to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) vulnerability using mimikatz zerologon module or other exploits from machine with “kali” hostname.
